name: Dream
description: Dream is an exploration game that takes place within the subconscious mind of Howard Phillips, a young man whose waking hours are tedious and dull, but whose dreams are lucid and powerful.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP (SP3), Windows Vista (SP2), Windows 7, Windows 8 Processor: 3.0 GHz Dual Core Processor Memory: 4 GB RAM Graphics: Shader Model 3 compliant graphics cards (GeForce GT 520/Radeon HD 3850 and above) DirectX: Version 9.0c Storage: 5 GB available space Sound Card: DirectX 9.0c compatible, 16-bit

reviews.review_text: A very different kind of game, one that may not be for everyone. Though I enjoy this very much, and it clearly has a lot to tell, especially if you are the kind of person that enjoys atmospheric, beautiful games. You'll be in for a very twisted fun journey with this one.  Full release update: Alright, so those who own this game know that it didn't have a good launch. But nowdays, that doesn't surprise me anymore. Inspite of all this, the team is working hard to fix these issues, and until I see them being more sorted out, I'll give this game a full playthrough.

Bought this when it was still on Early Access, but launched after the game was finally released and patched from bugs. The best thing in this game - MUSIC. Sad to say, Dream was a big dissapointment for me. Explorating the dreams and finding hidden paper notes with real meanings of them was quite exciting, but after a while I found myself annoyed and tired of walking and solving weird puzzles...not because puzzles here are too hard for me, they just lack of something that would made me stay with this game for longer. Maybe I will comeback to this later and change my opinion, for now it's just a annoying exploration game. And I really like exploration/adventure games.

This game is so good. It's so relaxing to play and the graphics are so nice, some bugs maybe here and there. When the game comes to the ''scary'' parts, like the nightmares, they really deliver. Its eerie and it feels like something is everywhere around you when you play. Just like scary should be.  This game all in all is about 7/10.

First and foremost, I didn't like this game upon purchasing way back when, almost half a year ago. The mechanics got some taking used to, the puzzles were sometimes difficult, almost unfair. So I stopped playing. Flash forward to several months later, when the creators of the game made leaps and bounds towards one of the best games I've ever played. The voice acting is more fluid, I know the characters better because of the little conversations in between and during dreams. As a young adult who will inherit property someday, I'd never thought a game could put my hesitance and challenges into words like this game does.   The music is wonderful, creative and sometimes a little bittersweet. I've never enjoyed a soundtrack more. The graphics are beautiful, so much in fact that I sometimes play just to take a peek at the rolling desert sand. The storyline makes this game a gem in a plethora of crappy indie games. The humor is kind, in fact, the entire game is kind. You never feel rushed unless playing a nightmare, and even then you're free to explore as much as you want.   The only thing that needs a little improving are the puzzles. They can be frustrating and almost nonsensical sometimes, but otherwise, 8.5/10

Dream is an abstract, puzzle-driven game that takes you through various beautiful environments. You take on the role of Howard Phillips (haha, get it?) Your uncle (a successful writer) has just died and bequethed his estate to you. You soon find that nights spent there lead to strange, surreal dreamscapes. Each dream presents a variety of challenging puzzles you must complete to develop your sense of self-worth, while nightmare scenarios serve to haunt you with your own insecurities. The graphics and soundtrack are lovely, the voice-acting is pretty good, the puzzles sufficiently engaging and the whole experience wraps up nicely into a fun game.

I do think it's a very nice game, looks well built and the attention to detail is there.  Note that in that sentence the key word was: 'Looks'.  For the majority, it runs well, but play further and some of the bugs reported come to the light. One of which I have found completely stops me from progressing further in the game   in Act 3  .  I actually like this game (to an extent for the time being), but I wouldn't suggest buying this right now. I sincerely hope as many of the reported bugs as possible have been tended to, then I just might change this review.

Now that the game is finally out i can make a meaningful review. this game is whimsical and very strange overall, just like a dream. the gameplay and story provide an escape from reality that is overall enjoyable. i would definetly reccomend giving this game a spin.
this game is one of the most beautiful things i've ever seen since naissancee. time to time it gives you goosebumps or peace and tranquility, it's a game of very intense feelings.
-11/10 would get lost in maze for 30 minutes again

Best thing i can say about it is that you first have to figure out that there's a puzzle, then how to solve it. It's never too complicated that either of those require googling it, but there are some bugs.

I found the game beautiful in it's asthetics but when it came to environment it seemed a bit... spoiler filled.  While the puzzles are well crafted you more often than not get hints or cheat-sheets handed to you on a silver platter.  I would easilly recomend this game to someone who is new to spacial navigation puzzles.  For any one that is well versed in the geanre you may find the asthetics and plot are the only thing really keeping you here.
Bad pacing, bad voice acting, and lots of technical flaws.
well it crashes after i enter the first portal after i start sleeping help. I paid 10$ for this

After watching the promo videos and seeing the screenshots, I really wanted this game. I fantastic looking exploration game with puzzles and such. Sure it sounded awesome!  The first couple times I tried it, I really wasn't happy with it. Basically walking around aimlessly with no clue where to go or what to do. Then I started finding pieces of paper and items. OK, so that meant I had to find more stuff like this.  Well after an hour of walking around and not finding anything else besides some obscure graveyard puzzle, I'm calling it quits.  This game is just too laggy and slow to be playable and enjoyable. Yes, the scenery is nice, but the music gets on your nerves and the slow responding controls are too unbearable.   Save your money.

Very pretty game, I'm not one to play single player games, but this has been one of the few that's managed to hold my attention. I personally still like to pic it up and play it every once in a while. There are some areas where it could use a little polish, but my time with it has been well spent. If it's on sale I'd recommend that anyone buy it!

This game is terrible, tremendous piles of crap. The looks and atmosphere are amazing. I got scared, and the music was good. BUT, there are so many problems! 1. The Oculus Rift on the floor in the bedroom, I looked at it, and then I couldnt back out, so i had to restart. 2. The Holiday food puzzle, half the buttons just stopped working, so I could not complete the puzzle. 3. I got stuck, literally couldn't move in several places, had to restart. The game is a good effort, but is still horribly broken. Don't buy it, crack it, it is not worth £10. It is worth £3 at most. Developers, you need to fix your game, seriously.
horrible dont waste your money

DREam tells the story of Doctor Dre, famed hip-hop artist and producer. In this game you play as Jerimiah Dre, a young black man who roams the crime ridden streets of Compton looking for ways to end gang violence.  The game genre is MMOFPS (Many Men Ovulate For Personal Salaries). You can team up with your friends to stop gangs from taking the streets of Compton. You can also form a rap group called 'N.W.A' which stands for ♥♥♥♥♥z Wit Attitude  It is not good.
It's pretty and fun. That's all you need to know
The narrators voice will annoy you... other than that, not bad.  7/10
puke inducing

The first time I played this game for a short time or so, I had made it to the Catacombs and lost interest as the exploration to that point seemed bland. When I loaded up again to keep going, the game changed for me, and I was set in a beautiful world, with many dicoveries to make, smokes to run from, screenshots to take, and horrors to come. I have had no problems whatsoever with the actual gameplay, and I definately like the game.
This game disappointed me about as much as Dead Island did. I was so psyched.
Very strange. Just weird at times. But thats why it called Dream, I guess.

Ok I recommend this game IF you like 1st person puzzle games (Like Ether One, though it isn't nearly as good as that) AND don't mind a slower pace. It's fairly interesting, The puzzles are nice and I like the setting. However this game does have some downsides that seriously injure it so wait till it's on sale. Don't pay the full price unless you think you REALLY want it.  Let me give you a rundown of the largest cons.   -THE ITEMS! I beat the whole game without using a SINGLE item. Oh it gives you plenty and you have an easy enough to understand inventory that allows you to swap between them but all I could think was 'What is the point of these useless items?' Well here's the thing, the items have uses but you can beat the game without using any of them, additionally the game never bothers to tell you that you can use an item by hitting F while you are holding it.  -The forced dialogue! There's a conversation that gets revisted several times throughout the game and basically it builds the background. As you progress through the game more and more of the conversation gets revealed (about 4-5 segments in total). It's a cool mechanic HOWEVER, there is no way to fast forward through the parts you've heard already meaning you will be hearing the same begining conversation several times and it will get longer each time. So basically be prepared to go do something for a few minutes every time you finish a level.  Minor beefs include:  -too much character visability for a first person game. (This is just a personal preference of mine when I'm playing first person games I don't want to see the character other than arms or in the occasional mirror) -controls are a bit shakey (not terrible you get used to them soon enough) -not really enough puzzles -slightly empty at parts  Good things This game does a fair amount well. -The setting is cool and the level designs are interesting. (Personally I particularly enjoy settings where things are slightly out of place and this dream game does that well.) -The self narration seemed odd at first but I think it goes well with how the game turns out as it's about understanding the character. -The puzzles are enjoyable for the most part.  TLDR: If you like 1st person puzzle games, get when on sale.  Tips for playing: -F to use current item -select the empty hand if you don't want to hold an item atm -the paper changes when the dream changes check it often -the alarm clock wakes you up allowing you to exit the current dream if you get stuck.

I watched the trailer and thought this game would be fun and relaxing. I bought it for a higher price then most FUN games and started playing it. I could not pass the first dream and had no fun trying to navigate through it. If you're looking for a casual game, I suggest you keep looking.

A puzzle in Act 3 cannot be completed, because the buttons don't have triggers. This locked me out of completing the game. That combined with poor framerates (with graphics that shouldn't plummet the FPS), and no updates since August, leaves the game too much of a mess for it to be worth $17
I absolutely love how original, creative, and fresh this is!

Dream, is certainly weird but in a strange way enjoyable. Like a strange cross between Mind: Path to Thalamus and Gone Home, this walking simulator will have you scratching your head, then feeling determined to solve all these puzzles that are being put before you. The landscapes in Howard'as dreams also look pretty darn good too. I hear some people had some nasty glitched when they played, but my play nexperience was just fine. I would most certainly reccommend this game to fans of games like Gone Home, who like some degree of challenge and a tinge of mystery and spookiness to spice it up slightly.
